Package com.bsr.bitnicorm

Interface ISession

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Closeable
All Known Implementing Classes:
Configure
public interface ISession extends Closeable
Database work unit

  • Method Details

    • update

      <T> int update(@NonNull T item)
      Convenience method for updating rows in the database.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      item - An object, class type must be marked with annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Returns:
      1-success -1 - not success 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name"));
 var o=session.firstOrDefault(SimpleTable.class,null);
 o.myName="newName";
 var res=session.update(o);

    • insert

      <T> int insert(@NonNull T item)
      Convenience method for inserting a row into the database.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      item - An object, class type must be marked with annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Returns:
      1-success, -1 - not success 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name"));
 var o=session.firstOrDefault(SimpleTable.class,null);
 o.myName="newName";
 var res=session.update(o);

    • insertBulk

      <T> void insertBulk(@NonNull List<T> tList)
      Batch insert, please note that if objects contain incremental primary keys, these key fields are not updated after insertion.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
  List<SimpleTable> list=new ArrayList<>();
  for (int i = 0; i < 400 ; i++) {
     list.add(new SimpleTable("name:"+i));
   }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insertBulk(list);
      Parameters:
      tList - The list of objects of class type must be marked with annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName

    • insertBulk

      <T> void insertBulk(T... object)
      Batch insert, please note that if objects contain incremental primary keys, these key fields are not updated after insertion.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation MapTable or MapTableName 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insertBulk(new SimpleTable("name:"+1),new SimpleTable("name:"+2));
      Parameters:
      object - A collection of objects of class type must be marked with the annotation MapTable or MapTableName

    • delete

      <T> int delete(@NonNull T item)
      Convenience method for deleting rows in the database.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      item - An object, class type must be marked with annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Returns:
      1-success -1 - not success 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name"));
 var o=session.firstOrDefault(SimpleTable.class,null);
 var res = session.delete(o);

    • updateAll

      <T> int updateAll(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, @NonNull PairColumnValue columnValues, String where, Object... objects)
      Updating rows in a database based on a condition without loading rows on the client
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      columnValues - objects of type PairColumnValue
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      Number of affected records 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name"));
 session.updateAll(SimpleTable.class,new PairColumnValue().put("myName","newName"),null);

    • getList

      <T> List<T> getList(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects)
      Getting a list of rows from a database table based on a condition
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      list objects of type T 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name1"));
 var list=session.getList(SimpleTable.class,"name = ?","name1");

     public String myName;
 }

 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name1"));
 var list=session.getList(SimpleTable.class);
 //select all rows

    • executeScalar

      Object executeScalar(@NonNull String sql, Object... objects)
      Use the ExecuteScalar method to retrieve a single value (for example, an aggregate value) from a database.Using parameters
      Parameters:
      sql - SQL script in raw form, the ability to change values with the ? symbol, the observed values must be written to the object parameter, in the order in which they are written in the script.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      objects of any type 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name1"));
 var count =session.executeScalar("Select count(*) from 'SimpleTable' where name = ?","name1");

    • executeScalar

      Object executeScalar(@NonNull String sql)
      Use the ExecuteScalar method to retrieve a single value (for example, an aggregate value) from a database
      Parameters:
      sql - SQL script in raw form, the ability to change values with the ? symbol, the observed values must be written to the object parameter, in the order in which they are written in the script.
      Returns:
      objects of any type 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name1"));
 var id =session.executeScalar(""SELECT last_insert_rowid();"");

    • executeSQL

      void executeSQL(@NonNull String sql, Object... objects)
      Executing a raw query to the database
      Parameters:
      sql - SQL script in raw form, the ability to change values with the ? symbol, the observed values must be written to the object parameter, in the order in which they are written in the script.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols. 
       
 @MapTable
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.execSQL("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS test_name ON 'test' ('name');");

    • execSQLRaw

      android.database.Cursor execSQLRaw(@NonNull String sql, Object... objects)
      Executing a raw query to the database, obtaining a cursor
      Parameters:
      sql - SQL script in raw form, the ability to change values with the ? symbol, the observed values must be written to the object parameter, in the order in which they are written in the script.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      @see Cursor 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 Cursor cursor= execSQLRaw("select * from "+ session.getTableName(SimpleTable.class));

    • execSQLRawMap

      List<Map<String,Object>> execSQLRawMap(@NonNull String sql, Object... objects)
      Obtaining the resulting sample based on a condition
      Parameters:
      sql - SQL script in raw form, the ability to change values with the ? symbol, the observed values must be written to the object parameter, in the order in which they are written in the script.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      Dictionary: table column name - column value 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 List<Map<String,Object>> res= execSQLRawMap("select mame,id from "+ session.getTableName(SimpleTable.class));
 res.forEach(row -> {
  Log.I("---",row.get("name"));
  Log.I("---",row.get("id"));
 });

    • execSQLRawArray

      List<Object[]> execSQLRawArray(@NonNull String sql, Object... objects)
      Obtaining the resulting sample based on a condition
      Parameters:
      sql - SQL script in raw form, the ability to change values with the ? symbol, the observed values must be written to the object parameter, in the order in which they are written in the script.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      list Object[] 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
  List<Object[]> res= execSQLRawMap("select mame,id from "+ session.getTableName(SimpleTable.class));
 res.forEach(row -> {
  Log.I("---",row[0]);//name
  Log.I("---",row[1]);//id
 });

    • getTableName

      <T> String getTableName(@NonNull Class<T> aClass)
      Getting the table name is usually needed to build a raw query.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      Returns:
      string as table name 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 Cursor cursor= execSQLRaw("select * from "+ session.getTableName(SimpleTable.class));

    • beginTransaction

      void beginTransaction()
      Begins a transaction in EXCLUSIVE mode. 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.deleteRows(MyTable.class);
 session.beginTransaction();
 try {
     for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
         session.insert(factoryTable());
     }
     session.commitTransaction();
 }catch (Exception e){}
 finally {
     session.endTransaction();
 }
 var res=session.count(MyTable.class);
 assertEquals(10,res);

    • commitTransaction

      void commitTransaction()
      Marks the current transaction as successful. Do not do any more database work between calling this and calling endTransaction. Do as little non-database work as possible in that situation too. If any errors are encountered between this and endTransaction the transaction will still be committed. 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.deleteRows(MyTable.class);
 session.beginTransaction();
 try {
     for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
         session.insert(factoryTable());
     }
     session.commitTransaction();
 }catch (Exception e){}
 finally {
     session.endTransaction();
 }
 var res=session.count(MyTable.class);
 assertEquals(10,res);

    • endTransaction

      void endTransaction()
      End a transaction 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.deleteRows(MyTable.class);
 session.beginTransaction();
 try {
     for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
         session.insert(factoryTable());
     }
     session.commitTransaction();
 }catch (Exception e){}
 finally {
     session.endTransaction();
 }
 var res=session.count(MyTable.class);
 assertEquals(10,res);

    • tableExists

      <T> boolean tableExists(@NonNull Class<T> aClass)
      Checks if a table exists in the database.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      Returns:
      true - is existing, false - not exists 
       
 @MapTable

 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 try{
    if(session.tableExists(SimpleTable.class)==false){
       session.createTable(SimpleTable.class);
     }
 }catch(Exception e){}

    • deleteRows

      <T> int deleteRows(@NonNull Class<T> aClass)
      Deletes all rows from a table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      Returns:
      Number of affected records 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    session.insert(new SimpleTable("name:"+i);
 }
 var res=session.deleteRows(SimpleTable.class));
 // delete all rows
 assertEquals(10,res);
 var list=session.getList(SimpleTable.class);
 assertEquals(0,list.size());

    • deleteRows

      <T> int deleteRows(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects)
      Deletes rows from a table based on a condition
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      Number of affected records 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
    session.insert(new SimpleTable("name:"+i);
 }
 var res=session.deleteRows(SimpleTable.class,"name not null"));
 // delete rows only where name not null
 assertEquals(10,res);
 var list=session.getList(SimpleTable.class);
 assertEquals(0,list.size());

    • dropTableIfExists

      void dropTableIfExists(@NonNull String tableName)
      Drops the table if it exists.
      Parameters:
      tableName - table name 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.dropTableIfExists(session.getTableName(MyTable.class));
 var res=session.tableExists(MyTable.class);
 assertEquals(false,res);

    • dropTableIfExists

 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.dropTableIfExists(MyTable.class);
 var res=session.tableExists(MyTable.class);
 assertEquals(false,res);
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.

    • count

      <T> int count(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects)
      Gets the number of rows in a table, based on a condition
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols. A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      number of records in a table with selection condition

    • any

      <T> boolean any(@NonNull Class<T> aClass)
      Checks if rows exist in a table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      Returns:
      true not Empty table, false - Empty table 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.deleteRows(SimpleTable.class);
 for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
     session.insert(new SimpleTable("name:"+i));
 }
 var res=session.any(SimpleTable.class);
 assertEquals(true,res);
 var res2=session.any(SimpleTable.class,"name=?","simple");
 assertEquals(false,res2);

    • any

      <T> boolean any(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects)
      Checks if rows exist in a table based on a condition
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      true - there are records, false - no entries 
       
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.deleteRows(SimpleTable.class);
 for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
     session.insert(new SimpleTable("name:"+i));
 }
 var res=session.any(SimpleTable.class);
 assertEquals(true,res);
 var res2=session.any(SimpleTable.class,"name=?","simple");
 assertEquals(false,res2);

    • firstOrDefault

      <T> T firstOrDefault(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects)
      Gets the first value based on a condition; if it doesn't exist, returns null.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      object of type T or null 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 session.insert(new SimpleTable("name"));
 var o=session.firstOrDefault(SimpleTable.class,"name not null");
 o.myName="newName";
 var res=session.update(o);

    • first

      <T> T first(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects) throws Exception
      Get the first value based on the condition, if it does not exist, an exception is thrown
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      objects of type T or Exception
      Throws:
      Exception - 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 try {
   SimpleTable  res=session.first(SimpleTable.class,"name=?","ion");
 } catch (Exception e) {}

    • single

      <T> T single(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects) throws Exception
      Gets a single object based on a condition. If the condition is not met: the object is not found, or there is more than one, an exception is thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      objects or Exception
      Throws:
      Exception - 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 try {
   SimpleTable  res=session.single(SimpleTable.class,"id=10");
   // or session.single(SimpleTable.class,"id=?",10);
 } catch (Exception e) {}

    • singleOrDefault

      <T> T singleOrDefault(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String where, Object... objects)
      Returns a single object; if there is none or it is not the only one, null is returned.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
   SimpleTable  res=session.singleOrDefault(SimpleTable.class,"id=10");
   // or session.singleOrDefault(SimpleTable.class,"id=?",10);
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      The first object obtained by the condition, if the object does not exist, will return null

    • getListSelect

      <T, D> List<D> getListSelect(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, String columnName, String where, Object... objects)
      Getting a list of values for one field of a database table
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      D - any type
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class
      columnName - The name of the field in the table by which the selection is made
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      List objects any types 
       
 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 List<String>  res=session.getListSelect(SimpleTable.class,"name","name not null");

    • cursorIterator

      <T> void cursorIterator(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, android.database.Cursor cursor, IFunctionCallback<T> function)
      An iterator for traversing a Cursor with a callback function
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName 
       

 @MapTable
 public class SimpleTable {
     public SimpleTable(){}
     public SimpleTable(String name){
         this.myName = name;
     }
     @MapPrimaryKey
     public long id;
     @MapColumnName("name")
     public String myName;
 }
 ISession session=Configure.getSession();
 var cursor=session.execSQLRaw("select "name" from "+session.getTableName(SimpleTable.class));
 List<String> stringList=new ArrayList<>();
 session.cursorIterator(SimpleTable.class,cursor,o -> {
   stringList.add(o.name);
 });
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      cursor - @see Cursor
      function - lambda realisation IFunctionCallback

    • groupBy

      <T> Map<Object,List<T>> groupBy(@NonNull Class<T> aClass, @NonNull String columnName, String where, Object... objects)
      Obtaining a dictionary of objects grouped by a database table column, with a selection condition
      Type Parameters:
      T - The generic type must represent a class marked with the annotation @MapTable or @MapTableName
      Parameters:
      aClass - Instances of the represent classes and interfaces in a running Java application. This class must be annotated with the @MapTable or @MapTableName annotation, have a public parameterless constructor, and a public field marked with the primary key annotation.
      columnName - The column in the database table by which grouping occurs
      where - A fragment of a SQL query script from a condition, where the condition, the word where, need not be written, string parameters are replaced with the parameter substitution character `?`, and parameter values are entered into the object collection in the order they appear in the query.
      objects - A collection of objects that replace the `?` symbols in a script, the order of the objects matches the order of the `?` symbols.
      Returns:
      result map, key is the grouping value, value is the list of objects in which this value occurs
